data.title: The Holland Film Meeting is supported by - Nederlands Film Festival
data.meta_description: The Holland Film Meeting is supported by - Nederlands Film Festival
data.text: DUTCH PROJECTS • CORNEA Jochem de Vries ; NFI Productions Feature film debut of Amsterdam-based Jochem de Vries whose short film ‘Missen’ was nominated for a Palme d’Or 2009. His short documentary, ‘Trans-Siberian Voices’, also screened at Cannes 2009 (Critics Week). NFI Productions’ feature films include ‘Does it Hurt?’ (2006) by Aneta Lesnikovska, nominated for a Tiger Award IFFR 2007. Esther Rots’ feature ‘Can Go Through Skin’ (2009) was selected for the Forum, Berlinale 2009. • HEAVEN ON EARTH Pieter Kuijpers; Pupkin Films Pupkin Films’ co-founder Pieter Kuijpers’ first feature film, ‘Godforsaken’ (‘Van God Los’, 2003), received Golden Calf Awards for Best Director, Best Screenplay and Best Actor. Since then he has directed ‘Off Screen’ (2005), ‘De griezelbus’ (2005), which received Best of the Fest Award at the Chicago International Children’s Film Fest, ‘Dennis P.’ (2007), which won Golden Calves for Best Actor, Best Actress and Best Supporting Actor, and ‘Nothing To Lose’ (‘TBS’, 2008) which won the Jury Award at the Philidelphia Film Festival 2008. • KNEELING ON A BED OF VIOLETS Ben Sombogaart; NL Film & TV Based on the Dutch novel of the same name by Jan Siebelink. Sombogaart’s feature films include ‘Bride Flight’ (2008), ‘Crusade in Jeans’ (2006) and ‘Twin Sisters’ (2002), which was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film 2003. ‘The Storm’, also produced by NL Film & TV, will be shown during this year’s Netherlands Film Festival. • LAND Jan-Willem van Ewijk; Augustus Film Having worked as an investment banker before making his very well-received international debut feature ‘Nu’, Van Ewijk was selected to participate in this year’s Sundance Screenwriters’ Lab with ‘Land’, co-written with Moroccan Abdelhadi Samih, to be produced by Bero Beyer (‘Paradise Now’, 2005). • MY SISTER CAME BY TODAY Yan Ting Yuen; seriousFilm Filmmaker Yan Ting Yuen’s first feature, the documentary ‘Yang Ban Xi’: ‘The 8 Modelworks’ (2005), was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize for Best Foreign Documentary at Sundance 2005. Rotterdam-based production company seriousFilm is owned by Marc Thelosen, Koert Davidse and Yan Ting Yuen. Productions include ‘Manifesto for a Free Fall’ (2008) and ‘The World as a Collection’ (2007). • NAMUS Paula van der Oest; Pupkin Films Paula van der Oest is currently finishing ‘Smoke and Ochre’, (starring Carice van Houten, producer Riba Film International/IDTV Film). Her ‘Zus & Zo’, produced by De Luwte, was nominated for the Foreign Language Oscar in 2003. Producer/director Pieter Kuijpers’ films include a.o. ‘Nothing to Lose’ (‘TBS’ 2008) and ‘Godforsaken’ (‘Van God Los’, 2003). The Holland Film Meeting is supported by
